comments.comment: For context at 1:58 : The U.N. general assembly voted to recommend a two state solution to the U.N. security council. The U.N. security council never actually voted to adopt this proposal.On may 14, 1948, Israel declared itself independent. The U.N. did not authorize this, and it was done against the will of the vast majority of native Palestinians living there. Sources: 'The impact of Israels founding myths on the prospects for a two-state solution' by Andrew J Winnick. Sir Elihu Lauterpacht, Judge Ad Hoc of the International Court of Justice: "The coming into existence of Israel does not depend legally upon the Resolution. The right of the state to exist flows from its factual existence."
